PERSONA:
harold reed, a 57-year-old white non-hispanic male living in a non-metropolitan area of the east south central census division of the united states. he resides in a small town in the heart of alabama, surrounded by rolling hills and vast farmlands.

married to his high school sweetheart, barbara, for over 35 years, harold has two adult children who have moved out to start their families. his wife, barbara, is a part-time school secretary, supplementing their income. harold has a strong protestant upbringing and is a devout born-again christian, frequently attending the local baptist church more than once a week. his faith significantly influences his conservative ideology and informs his republican party affiliation.

as a high school graduate, harold has an associate's degree in diesel mechanics from a local community college. he works as a diesel engine technician for a medium-sized trucking firm based in his hometown. with over 25 years of experience, harold has a stable income of $65,000 per year, placing his family in the middle-income bracket.

harold and barbara own their two-story brick home, which they purchased 15 years ago for $120,000. they have been diligently paying off the mortgage and expect to pay it off within the next five years. their combined family income allows them to maintain a comfortable lifestyle, save for retirement, and invest in their children's education.

despite his conservative leanings, harold is pragmatic when it comes to economic policies. he supports policies that promote job security, reduce taxes for middle-class families, and encourage local businesses. however, he remains skeptical about increasing the minimum wage and expanding government-run healthcare programs, fearing these measures could stifle economic growth.

in his free time, harold enjoys outdoor activities like hunting and fishing. he is an avid user of the internet, frequently checking news websites, social media, and forums related to his hobbies. as a self-proclaimed "news junkie," harold stays informed about local and national politics.

harold is certain about his voter registration status and has consistently voted in local and national elections. he leans toward candidates with conservative values and a strong track record of supporting small businesses and job creation. given his strong faith and community ties, harold's views on social issues tend to be traditional, and he is more likely to support candidates who align with his values.

despite his strong convictions, harold is not an active participant in volunteerism and tends to focus on supporting his community through his church and family activities. however, he does appreciate the role of community organizations in addressing local issues and might consider volunteering his time if the opportunity aligns with his interests and faith.
